metadata.title: CVE-2020-29481 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Access rights of Xenstorenodes are per domid. Unfortunately, existing granted access rights are notremoved when a domain is being destroyed. This means that a new domaincreated with the same domid will inherit the access rights to Xenstorenodes from the previous domain(s) with the same domid. Because all Xenstoreentries of a guest below /local/domain/<domid> are being deleted by Xentools when a guest is destroyed, only Xenstore entries of other guestsstill running are affected. For example, a newly created guest domain mightbe able to read sensitive information that had belonged to a previouslyexisting guest domain. Both Xenstore implementations (C and Ocaml) arevulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29481` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxendevicemodel1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenevtchn1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenforeignmemory1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxengnttab1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenhypfs1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenmisc4.17t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxenstore4t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxentoolcore1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
libxentoollog1t64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-4.17-amd64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-4.17-arm64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-4.17-armhf - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-utils-4.17 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xen-utils-common - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
xenstore-utils - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-2').
